content:
For those who like coding, and playing Android games, check out Algorithm City : Coding Game. I just discovered it and have been having some fun with it :smile:

Algorithm City : Coding Game - Apps on Google Play
The game is a fun and innovative coding game to teach the basics of programming and algorithm. It teaches coding with fun games with the animals. The players gain the basic concepts of coding, like command sequencing, functions and loops, by guiding the character by collecting golds and solving levels. There are many characters (penguin, fox, cow, ladybug, angry bird, rabbit, chicken, etc.) in shop screen. Algorithm City features 51 levels in 4 chapters. Educational Chapter has 6 levels, it teaches how to do. Easy Chapter has 15 levels, it teaches the basics of coding. Normal Chapter has 15 levels, it teaches loops by using functions. Hard Chapter has 15 levels, it teaches functions.
Thanks for starting this topic @BWPanda (Peter) :+1:
Cool, maybe I'll install that on the tablet for the kids to use on our next road trip. ;)

I love open source! https://github.com/TugboatQA/Backdrop-CMS-Starter-Kit/issues/10

Backdrop Drush download URL incorrect · Issue #10 · TugboatQA/Backdrop-CMS-Starter-Kit
The URL for downloading Backdrop Drush is incorrect and prevents the build from completing. Old URL: https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/drush/archive/1.x-0.x.zip New URL: https://github.com/backdr...
Finished all levels of Algorithm City with 3 stars! :grinning_face_with_smiling_eyes:

I had no idea that 1 second is calculated as the "time of 9 192 631 770 periods of the radiation corresponding to the transition between the 2 hyperfine levels of the ground state of the caesium 133 atom at 0 K"
(http://www.kylesconverter.com/time/months-to-seconds)
Wow. I guess it's from one electron quantum state to another? (My chemistry courses are just dimly remembered)

I had no idea that 1 second is calculated as the "time of 9 192 631 770 periods of the radiation corresponding to the transition between the 2 hyperfine levels of the ground state of the caesium 133 atom at 0 K"
(http://www.kylesconverter.com/time/months-to-seconds)

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_System_of_Units#Base_units

International System of Units - Wikipedia
The International System of Units (SI, abbreviated from the French Système international (d'unités)) is the modern form of the metric system and is the most widely used system of measurement[citation needed]. It comprises a coherent system of units of measurement built on seven base units, which are the second, metre, kilogram, ampere, kelvin, mole, candela, and a set of twenty prefixes to the unit names and unit symbols that may be used when specifying multiples and fractions of the units. The system also specifies names for 22 derived units, such as lumen and watt, for other common physical quantities.
@Laryn It seems we were helping each other out in Drupal land 11 years ago! https://www.drupal.org/project/views/issues/446798#comment-1540178
@BWPanda (Peter) Ha! Hey there old friend!
If iOS had a custom kernel, would it be called Apple Core...? :big_smile:
Interesting: https://www.fsf.org/windows/upcycle-windows-7
(deleted)
Is someone talking about me?

I hope the dragonbot didn't scare anyone...
;-)

Does anyone have a minute to tell me if this link is working for them: http://www.cocreatz.org/

CoCreatz - Coworking & Venue
CoCreatz is a new coworking space on the first floor of the historic building at the southwest corner of Raymond and University Avenues — the crossroads of Minneapolis and Saint Paul. CoCreatz was born from a neighborhood initiative to provide a community gathering place in the Creative Enterprise
it works for me
This is really weird. The folks at CoCreatz say it's working fine, but I am being taken to some page that looks VERY hacked.
This is the potential venue for our Twin CIties event during DrupalCon.
I am trying every version the URL and cannot access their site. How can that be?
WFM too @StPaulTim
I am really puzzled by this. I've tried to access it in multiple browsers and can't.
Makes me wonder about the coffee shop WiFi network I am using.
Does it work from your mobile phone (while not connected to that cafe WiFi)?
OK, I just hopped onto a VPN I use for work with a specific client and I can access the site just fine through the VPN. Does that mean I'm hacked or could it be something in the WiFi network I'm on?
This is the only site I've had any problems with.
Maybe the wifi is inserting stuff into the packets? Is it https?
@klonos phpcs; https://serundeputy.io/automate-backdrop-coding-standards-your-projects
i run that locally in my backdrop/backdrop clone against PRs and such;
@Herb If I open new browser window and just type in the URL - it does not forward to https and I get this:
looks like a firewall;
Access_Denied_-_Mozilla_Firefox.png
If I type the address with https, it is completely blocked.
The link in the screenshot is very suspicious looking.
if you have the ability switch wifi networks;
If I type the address with https, it is completely blocked.
The link in the screenshot is very suspicious looking.
zyxel.com
I used the hot spot on my phone and do not see this there.
Should I be concerned about being on this network at all?
it seems like they have a firewall
Zyxel is a network equipment manufacturer.
I've used some of their equipment before.

Well, I don't think they do intentionally (have a firewall). https://www.peacecoffee.com/ (the coffeeshop I'm at).

Peace Coffee | Organic, Fair Trade, Fresh Roasted in Minneapolis, MN
Proudly roasting, pedaling, and brewing outstanding fair trade and organic coffee in the Twin Cities since 1996.
I'll bet something on the site triggered a rule that caused that behavior. I think it would be worth finding out, but I'll also bet no one there knows anything about it.
Yeah, I showed them (the barrista) the problem without any expectation that they will know anything about it. But, at least they are aware if other people also have problems.
It reminds me of what happened to me a couple days ago. I tried using Safari on a friend's Mac in guest mode. It had parental controls and was blocking access to all websites with https!
It was an old version of Mac OS
Maybe they have some crappy filtering going on

https://www.hook42.com/blog/so-long-and-thanks-all-fish

So long, and thanks for all the fish! | Hook 42 SF Bay Area Drupal Experts and WordPress Experts
It's a very sad week for us at Hook 42. COVID-19 has hit our clients and our families hard, and we regret to announce that we're closing up shop at the end of the month. Hook 42 has been driven by our core values since we started in 2012: honesty, quality, community, ongoing improvement, work/life balance, and humor. We've loved being part of the open source community, in particular, the Drupal community all these years. We will always have fond memories of working with an amazing team, great clients, and wonderful community members.

Joseph Flatt said:

https://www.hook42.com/blog/so-long-and-thanks-all-fish

oh wow! sorry to hear. hope you guys will be ok.
Likewise @Joseph Flatt and @oadaeh (Jason Flatt) , super sorry to hear this. Let us know if there's some support you could use from us here!
I think everyone is going to be fine. It's just a bit stressful and everyone is looking for new work at the moment.

Update with my situation: we are trying to re-book our travel for a few weeks time, as the current situation is becoming impossible (flights being cancelled and re-booked, 20-hr layovers in airports, etc.). So I'll be staying in Estonia/this timezone for the time being...
Sorry to hear @Joseph Flatt

Update from me: I'm in Doha airport. My flight to Thessaloniki was canceled, and they're flying me to Athens instead. ...at least I'm going to Greece (just means at least +3 to +4hrs added to my 24hr trip). But I'm well.
@klonos - Very glad for this update. I've been thinking about you and your journey all day. Best of luck on the final stages of your trip.

Hey all :wave: ...just wanted to communicate that work has been crazy, with gov sites receiving 40x normal traffic and urgent requests from gov agencies piling up ...work stress is depleting my energy, so I may not be as responsive as usual.
Understood.
Makes sense. @klonos take care of yourself.
